Package com.i2group.apollo.itemretrievalservice

The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform item retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve any version of any stored item, alone or in groups, in a variety of ways.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
IItemRetrievalService A pair of methods for retrieving Items from the repository.
 

Class Summary
TooManyItemsException.Fault Contains information about the enclosing TooManyItemsException.
 

Exception Summary
TooManyItemsException The exception raised when an attempt is made to retrieve more items than the server allows.
 

Package com.i2group.apollo.itemretrievalservice Description

The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform item retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve any version of any stored item, alone or in groups, in a variety of ways.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.

An Intelligence Analysis Platform client will come to the item retrieval service with one or more item identifiers that it has previously retrieved from the search service, or from the item retrieval service itself. These identifiers may be further qualified with version numbers. The item retrieval service then provides the following functionality:

Web methodDescription
GetItems Returns the specified versions of the items with the specified identifiers.
GetLatestItems Returns the latest versions of the items with the specified identifiers.

The results that the item retrieval service returns to clients in response to either of these methods are subject to the security rules of the Intelligence Analysis Platform. Clients never see items whose permissions dictate that the user should not have access to them.

Since:
1.0
